channel.title: 经济学人
channel.description: 这是一个追踪经济学人news的种子

item.title: 超过 60% 的法国人认为玛丽娜-勒庞的国民公署与其他政党无异。近三分之二的选民认为该党能够赢得选举。如果认为一旦它获胜，法国、欧洲或北约就能一如既往，那将是极其不明智的👇。
item.description:
Over 60% of the French see Marine Le Pen’s National Rally as a party like any other. Nearly two-thirds of voters think it can win office.

It would be extremely unwise to assume that, if it does, France, Europe or NATO could carry on as before https://t.co/OgXnbksJmS 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 28, 2024

item.title: 最新研究显示，全球最便宜的 20 座城市中有 9 座位于亚洲。但亚洲大陆也有一些世界上最昂贵的大都市👇。
item.description:
Nine of the world’s 20 cheapest cities are in Asia, according to new research. But the continent is also home to some of the world’s most exorbitant metropolises https://t.co/4opcedVYNV 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 28, 2024

item.title: 前间谍是特别有实力的作家。这些是我们推荐的最佳间谍小说👇。
item.description:
Former spooks make especially strong authors. These are our recommendations for the best spy novels https://t.co/UVEecE7BaN 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 28, 2024

item.title: 大多数服用抗抑郁药物的人并不需要这种药物。找出真正需要抗抑郁药的人，并让其他人摆脱这种药物👇。
item.description:
Most people on antidepressants don’t need them. Identify those who really do—and wean other people off them https://t.co/xVNgPTj5ym 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 28, 2024

item.title: 睡眠对人类健康至关重要。它占据了人一生中约三分之一的时间。然而，人们对它的了解却少得令人吃惊。一篇新论文试图填补一些空白 👇。
item.description:
Sleep is essential to human health. It takes up around one-third of people’s lives. And yet surprisingly little is known about it. A new paper attempts to fill some of the gaps https://t.co/JpquvahiaS 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 28, 2024

item.title: 五篇介绍如何简单而出色地写作的文章 👇
item.description:
Five texts that explain how to write simply and well https://t.co/cbQxF4H7f6 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 28, 2024

item.title: 社会对我们狂轰滥炸，要求我们变得更快乐、更健康、更富有。为什么我们变得如此不满足于平凡？ 👇
item.description:
Society bombards us with instructions to be happier, fitter and richer. Why have we become so dissatisfied with being ordinary? https://t.co/GwLIYyUsvs 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 28, 2024

item.title: 生命的 U 形弯曲--为何始于 46 👇?
item.description:
The U-bend of life—and why it begins at 46 https://t.co/c1ckUzdAnG 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 28, 2024

item.title: 中层管理者常常被认为是懒惰的。事实上，他们有一个共同的问题👇。
item.description:
Middle managers are often presumed to be lazy. In fact, they are suffering from a common problem https://t.co/2xlW21mJFn 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 28, 2024

item.title: "我们不需要单独作战，也不需要单独防御。@Gottemoeller在我们的 "制衡 "播客中解释了为什么北约对美国很重要🎧。
item.description:
“We don’t need to fight alone, and we don’t need to defend alone.” @Gottemoeller explains why NATO is important to America, on our “Checks and Balance” podcast https://t.co/LJg8uf9NpJ 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 27, 2024

item.title: 世界正在目睹一场前所未有的金融战争。但就在西方加紧制裁的同时，规避制裁的方法也变得越来越复杂👇。
item.description:
The world is witnessing an unprecedented surge in financial warfare. But just as the West ratchets up sanctions, ways to circumvent them are becoming more sophisticated https://t.co/o40TRWAhaO 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 27, 2024

item.title: 硅谷新发现的清醒有很多值得庆祝的地方。初创企业不再不惜一切代价追求增长。创始人重新发现了节俭。假以时日，独角兽的时代可能不会被错过 🦄。
item.description:
There is plenty to celebrate in the newfound sobriety of Silicon Valley. Startups have stopped espousing growth at all costs. Founders have rediscovered frugality. Many are being cautious with hiring.

In time, the age of the unicorn may not be missed https://t.co/oJ3z5lYo85 🦄

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 27, 2024

item.title: "不再是做大，而是要有创造力和速度"。这家法国初创公司证明，人工智能行业正变得更加开放，不再那么美国化 👇
item.description:
“It’s no longer about being bigger—it’s about being creative and being fast.” This French startup is proof that the AI industry is becoming more open and less American https://t.co/DYeZNuaYlS 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 27, 2024

item.title: "寻找暗物质的人一定是宇宙中最积极的人"。尽管屡屡找不到，@profcooley 还是告诉了 "巴贝奇 "暗物质研究人员为什么不会放弃🎧。
item.description:
“People searching for dark matter have to be the most positive people in the universe.”

Despite repeatedly not finding it, @profcooley tells “Babbage” why dark matter researchers won’t give up https://t.co/mJUpN9WFxz 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 27, 2024

item.title: 高端时尚界又添新成员。我们将解释古驰、普拉达和蒂芙尼为何在零售地产上大举下注👇。
item.description:
High-end fashion has some new houses. We explain why Gucci, Prada and Tiffany’s are betting big on retail property https://t.co/Ka9mXVEkMX 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 27, 2024

item.title: "我们载歌载舞，谈论着我们的新生活。"在经历了两年的战争和苦难之后，三位乌克兰学校的朋友得以在离校舞会上首次重聚。摄影师 @pollybraden 追踪了他们两年的旅程。
item.description:
“We were singing and dancing and talking about our new lives.”

After two years of war and hardship three Ukrainian school friends were able to reunite for the first time at a leavers’ prom. Photographer @pollybraden followed their journeys for two years https://t.co/6qIB1GolQW

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 27, 2024

item.title: 英伟达主导着人工智能芯片制造。任何希望取代它的竞争对手都需要关注三大领域 Philip Cheung/The New York Times/Redux/Eyevine
item.description:
Nvidia dominates AI chipmaking. Any competitor hoping to displace it will need to focus on three big areas https://t.co/ytvO1nFRVt

Image: Philip Cheung/The New York Times/Redux/Eyevine pic.twitter.com/cyDHBukizm

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 27, 2024

item.title: 尽管在塔利班统治下秘密为阿富汗女童提供教育冒着风险，但 Roya Azimi 说她并不害怕。"我有这种力量......这不是每个人都有的。她告诉《1843》杂志，她的工作就是把这种力量传递给她的学生们
item.description:
Despite the risks she’s taking by secretly schooling Afghan girls under the Taliban, Roya Azimi says she isn’t scared.

“I have this strength…and that’s not something everyone has.” Her job, she tells 1843 magazine, is to give that strength to her pupils https://t.co/bbwiEfGdBN

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 27, 2024

item.title: 美国极右翼钟爱的社交媒体平台 Parler 倒闭了，但它正在卷土重来。"情报局 "向 @hollieberman 提问，它是否会像以前那样蓬勃发展？
item.description:
Parler, a collapsed social-media platform beloved of America’s far right, is staging a comeback. “The Intelligence” asks @hollieberman whether it will thrive as it once did https://t.co/Tg0P3S4IAb pic.twitter.com/h2PU34Drpu

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 27, 2024

item.title: 中国共产党正试图加强对海外华人的控制。生活在国外更像是生活在国内 👇
item.description:
The Communist Party is trying to tighten its grip on the Chinese diaspora. Living outside the country has become more like living inside it https://t.co/gDRhzXsLOX 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 27, 2024

item.title: 本周的 "Money Talks "播客：人工智能可以改变教育，但让教育技术走进课堂是个令人头疼的问题 👇
item.description:
On this week’s “Money Talks” podcast: AI could transform education, but getting edtech into classrooms is a headache https://t.co/ivfkwwgCLw 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 27, 2024

item.title: 英国执政的保守党在民意调查中落后工党 20 个百分点。财政大臣应该怎么做？以下是一位虚构的财政部顾问在预算前的一些想法👇。
item.description:
Britain’s governing Conservatives trail Labour by 20 points in the opinion polls. What should the chancellor do? Here are some pre-budget thoughts from a fictitious Treasury adviser https://t.co/vUXAYNqGFg 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 27, 2024

item.description:
Why do Nvidia’s chips dominate the AI market? The firm has three big advantages: https://t.co/JlWEvh77oD 👇

item.title: 一位精神分析师解释了为什么对感到 "疲惫不堪 "的人来说，仅仅尝试放松并不总是有效 👇
item.description:
A psychoanalyst explains why for people feeling “burnt out”, simply trying to relax doesn’t always work https://t.co/5XeWnSdjjS 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 27, 2024

item.title: Refik Anadol 将人工智能作为一种创造性工具。有人将他的动画比作美化了的屏保和熔岩灯，比实质内容更壮观👇。
item.description:
Refik Anadol is using AI as a creative tool. Some compare his animations to glorified screensavers and lava lamps, more spectacular than substantive https://t.co/RYWwDpIgfs 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 27, 2024

item.title: 俄罗斯比欧洲贫穷得多，人口也少得多。弗拉基米尔-普京（Vladimir Putin）的掠夺使其国力日渐衰落。但它仍然可以散布破坏和苦难。欧洲需要以截然不同的方式思考防务问题--从现在开始 👇。
item.description:
Russia is much poorer and less populous than Europe. Vladimir Putin’s depredations make it a declining power. But it can still spread destruction and misery. Europe needs to think very differently about defence—and start now https://t.co/O2wXOijq45 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 27, 2024

item.title: 自俄罗斯两年前入侵以来，已有约 31 000 名乌克兰士兵丧生。有多少俄罗斯士兵丧生？这五张图表说明了巨大的损失👇。
item.description:
Some 31,000 Ukrainian troops have been killed since Russia invaded two years ago. How many Russian soldiers have died? These five charts illustrate the enormous losses https://t.co/psM0vH80JF 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 27, 2024

item.title: ♦️ 乔-拜登推动乌克兰援助和解决停摆问题。♦️ 密歇根州前往投票站。♦️ 总统和唐纳德-特朗普都将访问南部边境。请关注美国政治的最新动态： 👇
item.description:

♦️ Michigan heads to the polls.

The flaws that China’s chief ideologue found in America https://t.co/PNbKGHpXUG ⬇️

item.title: "一直以来，我们都在努力建造足够的住房，并为其提供资金"。@kcsalmon 向 "The Intelligence "讲述非洲大陆的住房危机
item.description:
“There’s been a struggle to build adequate homes, as well as finance them.” @kcsalmon tells “The Intelligence” about Africa’s continent-wide housing crisis https://t.co/KaOLrvQZfZ pic.twitter.com/acA7i18iAn
